thread.title: Met Éireann issues Status Yellow low temperature and ice warning for 10 counties
thread.title_full: Met Éireann issues Status Yellow low temperature and ice warning for 10 counties

author: Keith Kelly
title: Met Éireann issues Status Yellow low temperature and ice warning for 10 counties
text:
Met Éireann issues Status Yellow low temperature and ice warning for 10 counties
Status Yellow low temperature and ice warning has been issued for 10 countiesAlert valid from 11pm tonight and will expire tomorrow morning at 8am‘Wetter than average’ conditions have been forecast for next week
A Status Yellow low temperature and ice warning has been issued for 10 counties as temperatures of -3C are expected to create widespread frost and icy stretches across the country.
The national forecaster has issued the alert which will be valid from 11pm tonight and will expire tomorrow morning at 8am.
It will apply to counties Carlow, Kildare, Kilkenny, Laois, Longford, Meath, Offaly, Westmeath, Wicklow and Tipperary.
Met Éireann lists hazardous travel conditions and animal welfare concerns as the primary impacts of the warning.
A ⚠️Staus Yellow ⚠️low temperature warning has been issued for
— Met Éireann (@MetEireann)
Carlow, Kildare, Kilkenny, Laois, Longford, Meath, Offaly, Westmeath, Wicklow, Tipperary
Valid: 23:00 Thursday 20/11 to 08:00 Friday 21/11[pic.twitter.com/aX85UMjttp][November 20, 2025]
“Wetter than average” conditions have been forecast for next week as a previously issued Status Yellow snow and ice warning expires for counties Cavan, Donegal, Monaghan, Leitrim and Sligo today at noon, threatening dangerous driving conditions and icy stretches.
According to its extended range forecast, Met Éireann said low pressure in northern parts of Europe will lead to “wetter than average” rainfall with “above normal” temperatures for this time of year.
As for the remainder of this week, it is set to turn “unsettled” with spells of rain.
Today has begun very chilly, but dry, in many parts with the arrival of clear, sunny spells in the later morning and early afternoon.
Temperatures will reach between 3C and 7C.
Tonight will turn very cold again, with temperatures dropping to as low as -3C.
Tomorrow will start cloudy as rain picks up along Atlantic counties with temperatures of 5C to 9C. By night, that rain will spread eastwards over the rest of the country, becoming heaviest in the west with temperatures of 1C to 4C.
Saturday will be a slightly milder day nationwide with temperatures between 6C and 10C, rain clearing east in the morning as dry weather takes hold in the afternoon. Heaviest showers will be across Munster and southern Leinster.
On Saturday night, overcast conditions will prevail as as showers break out along eastern counties, turning heavy at times with lowest temperatures of 3C to 6C.
Sunday will see rain gradually clear away during the morning, but it will remain cloudy until the afternoon when sunny spells develop, mostly across the south. Daytime temperatures will reach between 7C and 10C, dipping to 0C to 4C at night.
